metadata.title: CVE-2016-9400 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
The CClient::ProcessServerPacket method in engine/client/client.cpp in Teeworlds before 0.6.4 allows remote servers to write to arbitrary physical memory locations and possibly execute arbitrary code via vectors involving snap handling.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2016-9400` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

teeworlds - 0.6.4+dfsg-1
teeworlds-data - 0.6.4+dfsg-1
teeworlds-server - 0.6.4+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: teeworlds package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.6.4+dfsg-1').
